positions.positionName: Director, Finance Operations - European Real Estate
positions.description:
Description

Realty Income, The Monthly Dividend Company®, is a US-Based REIT, listed on the NYSE. 
Our expansion into Europe is well underway, and we are hiring a Director, Finance Operations to help lead our Finance Group as we continue to grow internationally.
Realty Income (NYSE: O), an S&P 500 company, is real estate partner to the world's leading companies. Founded in 1969, we invest in diversified commercial real estate and have a portfolio of over 15,450 properties (including properties acquired in the Spirit merger in January 2024) in all 50 U.S. states and in seven countries in Europe. We are known as "The Monthly Dividend Company®," and have a mission to deliver stockholders dependable monthly dividends that grow over time. Since our founding, we have declared 645 consecutive monthly dividends and are a member of the S&P 500 Dividend Aristocrats® index for having increased our dividend for the last 25 consecutive years.
JOB SUMMARY:
The role has four key areas of focus:
---Establish the optimal operating model for accounts receivable and service charge in Continental Europe and UK;
---Provide leadership, direction, oversight, and monitoring of third party property managers in Continental Europe and UK as it relates to accounts receivable and service charge;
---Work closely with the US and European teams to manage the key metrics of importance for productivity and quality;
---Building and managing a team that scales with the business.

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:
European Operating Model
---Lead cross-departmental initiatives and interactions including the onboarding, systems setup, and process implementation to support expansion into new countries which includes working with third party implementation partners, property managers, and information technology.
---Develop policies and procedures to support Finance Operations in Continental Europe and UK.
---Develop workflows to use as a reference for general acquisitions as well as country specific.
---Develop workflows for country and entity specific.
---Develop checklists at various points in multiple processes.
---Engage and meet with other departments regularly (Legal, Strategy, Research, Accounts Receivable, Accounts Payable, Treasury, Accounting, Property Management, Information Technology) to identify their documented processes and identify challenges and areas for improved efficiencies.
---Understand Yardi's setup and reports used (property lists, entity lists) in order to facilitate onboarding additional Yardi features relating to new countries and creating efficiencies in existing processes.
Third Party Property Management Oversight and Monitoring
---Provide leadership, direction, oversight, and monitoring of third party property managers as it relates to accounts receivable and service charge responsibilities including:
---Collection and billing of rents and other income from the applicable property.
---Insurance and property tax payments, accruals, recoveries, and forecasting.
---Collection of service charge contributions recoverable from clients.
---Collection of service charge expenses, insurance premiums, and tax expenses from clients and performing annual reconciliations.
---Calculating, estimating, and apportioning service costs and insurance premiums and applying to clients for payments on an interim basis and on a final basis after the end of each accounting year, or in accordance with the client’s lease requirements. 
---Crediting clients with accrued interest where appropriate.
---Demanding arrears of rent, service charges, insurance contributions and other payments from clients, assisting solicitors and counsel and issuing instructions to solicitors or other collecting agencies for the recovery of arrears where appropriate.
---Ensure third-party property managers are maintaining published company policies and procedures as they relate to all aspects of Accounts Payable, Accounts Receivable, and Service Charge Reconciliations.
Property Tax, Insurance, and Service Charge
---Oversight of insurance and property tax payments, accruals, recoveries, and forecasting.
---Responsibility for the service charge cycle.
---Oversight of service charge reconciliations.
---Lead the implementation of Yardi service charge including related process reengineering. 
---Working with internal and third party property managers to monitor and calculate service charge costs.
---Ensuring that changes are calculated correctly and are relevant.
---Ensuring information to customers in clear and accurate.
---Ensure the prompt collection of service charges.
---Periodically review financial position with property managers and leadership where necessary.
---Liaise with auditors to track progress of and review service charge accounts.
---Liaise with internal and third party property managers on budgeting/billing ensure accuracy and transparency.
---Resolving any queries with customers.
Accounts Receivable
---Review and oversight of accounts receivable balances for Continental Europe and UK.
---Proactively follow-up on past due amounts and address any client disputes with regards to billing activities. 
---Coordinate with the European leadership team and third party property managers on serving of any notice of default.
---Assist in collectability analysis of month-end receivables balances.
---Oversight of cash application for portfolio tenant ledger charges.
---Recording charges to the tenant ledger for debtor balances in connection with entity acquisitions.
---Lead e-invoicing projects including the creation, transmission, and management of electronic invoices in compliance with European standards and regulations.
Portfolio Data Operations
---Process and data requirements as well as protocols to assist with country specific policies and procedures for Continental Europe and UK.
---Point of contact for third party property managers as it relates to Yardi input: invoicing, contacts, VAT, and translation.
---New acquisition DAS imports and portfolio activity updates with review/activation oversight according to country specific policies and procedures.
---International lease expiration tracking and vacancy reporting.
Acquisition Onboarding
---Collaborate with sellers, attorneys, and other related stakeholders to ensure an efficient and transparent property close.
---Audit financial statements alongside lease and ownership documents and provide analysis of operating expense leakage on potential acquisitions. 
---Propose language for releasing, new development, and post-closing agreements in order to maximize operating expense recoveries.
---Negotiate transaction language to minimize post-closing risk.
---Work closely with Acquisitions, the Legal Department and Asset Management to assimilate property acquisitions into the existing portfolio.
---Analyze debtor balances in accordance with the SPA and coordinate with Accounting on final NAV balances for entity acquisitions.
WHAT YOU'LL NEED TO BE SUCCESSFUL:
---Bachelor’s degree in Accounting/Finance; MBA preferred.
---10+ years of relevant work experience, preferably with REIT or real estate industry experience, including managing teams.
---5 years of experience in the management of employees preferable.
---Bilingual - Fluent in spoken and written English and Spanish.
---Dutch/EU resident preferred.
---Willingness to travel (up to 15%) domestically or internationally.

Job Type: 1-year fixed contract
What we offer:
---Competitive compensation and benefits package.
---The opportunity to join a stable, successful organization, AND make your mark on our European expansion currently in more of a “start-up” mode. The working hours and effort of our role will vary. We support work-life balance, with an understanding that the work of this role does not conform to a steady pace - there will be peaks and valleys to the amount of effort required for this role.

What to expect after you apply:
---First call: If your application matches the role, then it’s time to put a voice to the name! We’ll call you to set up a phone conversation with one of our Talent Partners
---Manager Screen: You will have the opportunity to discuss the role and your qualifications with the direct hiring manager. In this interview, we want to know more about you - what excites you about tax, real estate, and how can you help us solve global challenges.
---Second interview: You’ll meet with several of our team members at various levels. We'll dive into your potential role, showing you how you will fit into your team and contribute to our vision.
---The final decision: If you are the selected candidate, we will present you with an employment contract for your review and signature
---Pre-Employment Screening: If you choose to sign the employment contract, your personal data may be used for a pre-employment screening check by a third party as permitted by applicable law. Depending on the vacancy and applicable law, a pre-employment screening may include employment history, education, and other information (such as media information) that may be necessary for determining your qualifications and suitability for the role of Sr. Tax Manager.

Realty Income is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. If you require accessibility support to submit your application or other reasonable accommodations to participate in the recruitment process, please contact talent@realtyincome.com, or call 800-375-6700. An employee will respond to your message to begin the interactive process. Please note that this phone number and email address are only for individuals seeking a disability accommodation when applying for a job.

positions.description:
Description

Position Overview:
Reporting to the Global Chief Financial Officer, the SVP, Head of Finance and Accounting, UK and Europe will act as a strategic partner in the business and will oversee all accounting and transactional activities, including general accounting, financial reporting, technical accounting, accounts payable, tax and compliance, treasury management, finance systems and technology, finance transformation and operational excellence for our UK and European divisions. This key role will be a primary driver in shaping our international operational strategy, ensuring compliance with local GAAP and IFRS, and enhancing our accounting processes to drive efficiency and support a high-growth organization.
The Head of Finance and Accounting, UK and Europe will be an accomplished leader and strong communicator, providing thought leadership, driving process improvement and operational excellence, fostering cross-functional collaboration, and aligning reporting and compliance obligations with overall business priorities. Collaborative, visionary, and inspirational leadership will be pivotal to success at Realty Income. A key focus area will be driving change in a fast-paced, high-volume environment to effectuate a timely, efficient, and accurate financial close in alignment with the deadlines set forth by the U.S. parent company.
They will develop and execute strategies that consider the unique operating frameworks of multiple countries - ensuring compliance with various international financial regulations, tax laws, and reporting standards. They will oversee the preparation of consolidated financial statements that comply with IFRS and local GAAP requirements for each subsidiary or region. This role will also be responsible for optimizing global cash management and liquidity to support international operations. This may involve managing international banking relationships and optimizing the use of international banking services.
Key Responsibilities:
Leadership
---Be an active member of the executive and senior management committees designing and overseeing the implementation of the European expansion strategies.
---Lead operational, tax, and financial design of the European platform including staffing, systems, and infrastructure.
---Be a champion of change management, and a catalyst to motivate the European finance team to take ownership of building sustainable processes and developing solutions to operational challenges, in collaboration with colleagues in the U.S.
---Provide leadership and guidance to the Accounting, Corporate Finance, Finance Operations, and Information Technology teams in Europe.
---Build, manage, and mentor a team of accountants and operation staff in the European hub.
---Build, manage, and cultivate relationships with key suppliers and third parties across the European network.
---Project manage, make decisions for, and recommend structures for several various projects, including international expansion.
---Ensure that departmental financial and operational controls are consistently practiced.
---Cultivate and inspire a culture of high performance and continuous improvement with a commitment to maintaining high standards of professionalism of team members.
---Ensure that departmental financial and operational controls are consistently practiced.
Managing Technical Areas
---Model, design, and implement multi-jurisdictional legal structures optimizing operational and tax efficiencies.
---Oversee the development, alongside Legal and Internal audit, of best practice governance and operational policies and procedures for European structures and processes. 
---Oversee commercial, tax, and financial aspects of real estate transactions across Europe providing technical support and decision-making to legal and transaction teams.
---Oversee the general ledgers, accounts receivable, accounts payable, depreciation and tax records for all European company entities, including accounting transactions, applicable distributions, financial statement preparation and annual statutory audits.
---Oversee and develop a local GAAP reporting framework, utilizing the company's ERP system (Yardi).
---Work with the US Accounting team in finalizing the month-end accounting close for the European entities. 
---Work with our Tax Director to coordinate preparation of the applicable tax returns for Europe and ensure all local tax matters are processed correctly and timely.
---Work with the Technical Accounting Team to research and adopt new accounting standards and pronouncements, including coaching of the local European hub on financial controls and technical accounting changes.
---Provide support and consultation with regard to the coordination of hedging transactions with Corporate Finance.
---Oversee cash and treasury management within Europe, including the coordination of hedging transactions with Corporate Finance.
---Understand the equity accounting for restricted stock grants within Europe.
---Oversee reconciliation of international payroll accounts.
Strategy and Operational Excellence
---Operational creativity and a passion for process improvement is critical for this role. Implementing a vision and holding others accountable for meeting deadlines is pivotal.
---Drive automation and process improvement initiatives, reducing manual tasks, enhancing accuracy, and streamlining our accounting processes.
---Promote a culture of continuous improvement. Seek opportunities to enhance processes, reduce inefficiencies, and increase productivity.
Budgeting/Forecasting
---Maintain accountability for the development, maintenance and tracking of international budgets/forecasts.
---Identify and drive operational and cost efficiencies across the European platform.
Managing Reporting
---Coordinate the month-end reporting to the U.S. corporate headquarters for international transactions.
---Oversee and attend local and executive board meetings, providing experienced guidance and insights.
---Attend and present to Executive Board meetings and Audit Committees.
Internal Controls
---Direct implementation of accounting and information technology policies, practices, and procedures across Europe.
---Participate in applicable SOX walkthroughs.
---Establishes, documents, and ensures execution of internal controls to prevent inaccuracies in financial statements.
---Ensures a strong control environment by establishing, monitoring and enforcing operational and SOX controls based on corporate guidelines and general governance standards. Both support and challenge managers to identify areas where controls can be strengthened.
---Ensures ongoing compliance with statutory and regulatory requirements; anticipating future legislation; enforcing adherence to requirements; filing financial reports and advising management on needed actions.
---Implements, process improvements and automation where needed.
---Where appropriate, drive transformational initiatives aimed at consolidating and bringing transactional accounting work performed by external partners in-house.
Audits
---Ensure all local statutory accounts are compliant and filed on time, including working with local auditors on resolving technical matters.
---Take ownership of implementing resolution to any audit matters raised by external auditors.
Performs other duties as assigned. 
Qualifications: 
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
---Experience working in a high velocity, dynamic environment, acquiring portfolios and companies, where the environment can become intense, with multiple tasks occurring simultaneously, and where judgment must be exercised to assess risk expeditiously and thoughtfully. It is important that this individual has managed large teams of people before, with direct and indirect reports, and has the maturity and judgment to offer leadership and drive change within the group.
---Excellent Communication and presentation skills, including potential interface with the Board of Directors on occasion, and all EVP level officers of the company on a regular basis. Strong financial acumen, including understanding of company’s financial statements, notes to financial statements and budgeting techniques.
---Ability to multi-task under pressure.
---Strong Change Management and Leadership experience
---Require acute attention to detail, leadership skills, communication skills, problem solving/analytical abilities, time management skills, and critical-thinking abilities.
---Confident, yet courteous and “hands-on” work demeanor

Position Summary: 

Reporting to the SVP, Corporate Finance, the VP, Investor Relations will be responsible for developing and overseeing all aspects of investor relations efforts at Realty Income. The primary goals of the position is to further Realty Income's access to debt and equity capital and to increase the company’s name recognition, globally. Key initiatives include: first, developing and maintaining an investor targeting strategy that includes outreach to generalist institutional equity and fixed income investors; secondly, developing and maintaining industry and S&P 500 leading investor relations communications material, which could include development of presentations geared toward new and generalist investors, presentation(s) meant to engage fixed income investors, earnings call presentations, and the corporate website; thirdly, generating internal buy-in for as well as planning and executing Realty Income’s first investor day in 2025. The VP, Investor Relations will manage and mentor one to two junior staff members. 

The VP, Investor Relations will cultivate relationships with the investment community (institutional debt and equity investors, registered investment advisors, retail investors, and industry research analysts). A key objective of the role is to persuasively and credibly communicate Realty Income’s investment proposition to investors together with its strategy, financial performance, recent events, and ESG efforts in order to enhance the understanding of existing investors and cultivate interest from new investors. The VP, Investor Relations will adapt messaging as needed to position the company favorably to support our future success and will serve as the primary point of contact for all investor-related matters, collaborating closely with senior management and cross-functional stakeholders within the company. 

What you will be working on: 

Investor Communication 
---Develop, recommend to management, and then implement a comprehensive investor communication strategy to ensure effective and consistent messaging to the investment community.

---Develop, recommend to management, plan and carry out an investor day. This will include crafting presentation material around key themes, ensuring alignment with best practices, and managing preparation material and “day of” logistics. 
---Plan and carry out non-deal roadshows and property tours to maximize engagement with investors in the U.S. and abroad. 
---Prepare and deliver thoughtful and visually compelling investor presentations, craft and write earnings call scripts and other external messaging materials uniquely tailored to each of Realty Income’s stakeholder groups.
---Maintain running list of speaking points to address frequently asked questions by investors and analysts, ensuring consistency of message and facts amongst all external-facing individuals.

---Drive value internally by acting as a trusted advisor to senior leaders, providing insights around investor sentiment, positioning, and concerns.
Competitive Analysis and Benchmarking 
---Analyze and interpret financial data and investment industry trends which can be used to inform investor targeting and messaging.
---Prepare reports and presentations comparing competitors’ financial performance, operational metrics, and valuation metrics against other S&P 500 companies and industry benchmarks.

What is expected from you: 
---Minimum of 7-10+ years of experience in investor relations, equity research, corporate strategy and finance, investment banking, or consulting.
---Four-year bachelor’s degree with a major in Business Administration, Economics, Accounting, or Finance preferred. MBA, CFA, and/or CPA preferred.
---Strong ability to synthesize and convey strategic and financial messages in written materials and through PowerPoint.
---Strong ability to present strategic and financial messages in small and large group formats.

The Director of IT Service and Support is a strategic leadership role responsible for overseeing critical IT functions within our organization. The primary objective is to successfully manage, implement, and support IT solutions and processes across multiple domains.
Key responsibility areas include enterprise networking and computing infrastructure, IaaS platforms and services, desktop engineering, IT service monitoring, IT service integrations, and IT support. This role will manage and support the IT Operations and Service Desk team members through their day-to-day activities. This role is also responsible for SOX Audit tasks and controls on behalf of the IT Operations and Service Desk teams. Initiates and communicates various personnel actions, including recruiting, hiring, termination, training, performance reviews, disciplinary actions, and scheduling. Responsible for maintaining and creating IT policies and procedures used within the IT department. Continually gains knowledge of technology, SaaS/IaaS environments, and operational platforms to provide guidance, recommendations, technology roadmaps, operational policy, and subject matter expertise.

Leadership and Team Management:
---Lead and mentor the IT Operations team and Service Desk teams. Including UK and EU IT staff.
---Foster a collaborative and high-performance culture within the department.
---Provide strategic vision and execution plans for continuous improvement within the IT department.
---Responsible for IT Operations and Service Desk budgets and budget planning. 
---Partner with IT Program Management group and key stakeholders to prioritize and plan each team's work and priorities.
---Produce annual project and initiatives roadmap in coordination with the IT Program Management team.

---Ensure seamless coordination and alignment with outsourced service providers.
---Continuously monitor the performance of 3rd party vendors to ensure they are meeting contractual obligations

---Oversee the management and architecture of the enterprise infrastructure, including cloud and on-prem platforms.
---Oversee the design and administration of cloud computing platforms, AWS and Azure.
---Maintain ISP and telco services contracts and billing
---Responsible for the management of Directory services including Active Directory and Entra ID.
---Responsible for the implementation and optimization of enterprise storage solutions.
---Periodically participates in projects to integrate IT systems supporting company merger and acquisition activities.
---Develop and maintain the strategy for company email infrastructure.
---Continuously evaluate IT infrastructure needs for global expansion.
Support and Service Delivery
---Oversee day-to-day operations of the Service Desk team.
---Continuously evaluate and improve Service Desk processes related to employee onboarding, employee terminations, access provisioning, and end-user software delivery.
---Responsible for processes related to IT hardware inventory and asset management, including hardware lifecycles and disposition.
---Continuously assess and define appropriate Service Level Agreements to meet the needs of the organization.
---Ensure all work is completed in accordance with defined SLAs. 
---Mentor Service Desk analysts to foster growth within the Service Desk department.
Monitoring, Logging, and Alerting:
---Develop comprehensive IT service monitoring strategies and incident escalation. 
---Implement robust logging and alerting methodologies and response workflows to effectively respond to service-impacting incidents and events.
---Assist the Information Security team in security incident response.

---Collaborate with development teams to meet infrastructure and support needs.
---Implement and develop DevOps best practices in partnership with internal development teams.
---Implement automation and innovative solutions to effectively implement changes into the overall technology platforms for the company.
Documentation, Compliance, and Change Management:
---Document IT infrastructure and support processes comprehensively, including policies, standards, and procedures.
---Responsible for the IT Department document management platform.
---Ensure compliance with IT general controls and implement controls in new technology platforms, supporting SOX compliance.

---Enforce rigorous change management controls. Any system or configuration changes should undergo risk-impact assessment, planning, testing, approval, and documentation.
Disaster Recovery and Data Backups:
---Define and implement a robust backup strategy. Consider factors such as data volume, frequency, retention policies, recovery time objectives and storage locations.
---Regularly directs the operations team to test backup restoration processes to verify data integrity and recovery speed.
---Develop and maintain disaster recovery plans.

The Manager, Healthcare Strategy & Research will help drive Net Operating Income (NOI) by leading efforts to optimize portfolio growth strategies and inform capital & resource allocation decisions. As a key member of the business function, the manager will provide accurate, insightful, forward-looking and timely healthcare business and market intelligence, all in support of the proactive oversight of Ventas's Healthcare and Outpatient Medical & Research Portfolios (approximately 570 properties, $1B in Net Operating Income.)
Located in Chicago, the primary goal of this position is to develop current and predictive insights on the healthcare & life science industries and markets, policy and regulatory environments, and providers/tenants to identify opportunities and risks within the Healthcare and Outpatient Medical & Research Portfolios. Sectors of focus will include, but are not limited to, service providers (particularly care providers such as acute and specialty hospitals, and outpatient and post-acute settings), life science & biotech industry outlooks, tenant credit profiles and access to capital. Success means that recommendations from work will drive meaningful portfolio optimization and NOI impact once implemented.
The Manager will work in partnership with the Healthcare and Outpatient Medical & Research Asset Management teams and will report to VP, Asset Management. Additionally, the role will collaborate and interact with other internal teams such as Investments, Investor Relations, Corporate Finance, Financial Planning & Analysis, and Leasing.
Responsibilities: 
---Lead and conduct healthcare industry, regulatory, and market activity research across acute, post-acute, outpatient medical, and life science/research assets; provide recommendations based off of this research
---Provide thought leadership and prepare proactive and ad-hoc portfolio analyses, reports, and presentations for senior management and key stakeholders across Asset Management, Property Management & Leasing, Financial Planning & Analysis, and Investments to help guide operating and investment / disposition decisions
---Lead portfolio segmentation efforts to help inform resource & capital allocation, such as redevelopment and capital recycling opportunities; incorporate predictive analytics where applicable
---Lead benchmarking of REIT competitors and healthcare operators including public earnings coverage for multiple asset classes across the Healthcare and Outpatient Medical & Research portfolios
---Create and maintain system to receive, organize and digest key industry, policy and market events
---Maintain and continually enhance market tracker used to inform Asset Management teams and senior leadership of relevant recent industry/market/public policy events and themes
---Synthesize and communicate key industry, policy and market events to maintain sector theses
---Project future overall portfolio performance in assistance with Asset Management teams, while leveraging industry/competitor/market analysis, in efforts to proactively spot risk
---Lead other special and ad hoc projects as assigned by the VP, Asset Management
---Develop and prepare written materials (memos and presentations); present to Senior Leadership
---Maintain best practices by coordinating frequently with Senior Living Strategy & Analytics team
---Provide guidance and mentor Financial and Research Analyst(s)
Qualifications: 
---Bachelor's degree in Finance, Economics, Accounting, Real Estate or similar business field required
---Ideal candidate will have 7+ years’ experience in consulting, corporate strategy or finance in a management consulting or healthcare firm
---Deep experience and knowledge of the healthcare industry is a must; with emphasis in public policy, regulatory and reimbursement environments, along with ability to provide a view of historical and current healthcare trends to help inform future trends and the economic outlook across relevant sites of care
---Strong understanding of financial statements (Income Statement, Balance Sheet, Cash Flow)
---Strategic thinking and problem solving; ability to synthesize complex problems and facilitate decision-making; experience in writing business cases is a plus
---Ability to determine appropriate data needs, analyze data from multiple sources, draw insights, and effectively communicate key findings / recommendations

---Minimum of 5+ years of relevant and significant experience, including at a top tier law firm
